page.title: 14LOCAL TRADITIONS, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: {Hockliffe's annual fete}was originally held in the grounds of the{Rectory. Today it is held next door in the grounds of{Hockliffe Lodge.}It has become a tradition that the weather is always fine, and 1985 proved no exception.{The village school children {always perform country dancing.} {The village school's annual fete,}is always preceded by something different. This year it was{a concert {on the theme of Hiawatha.} One year {local hand bell ringers}demonstrated their skill. Traditionally the village has its own{ghost. A hooded nun}is seen walking from the{Rectory}to{the Crow's {Nest thatched cottage opposite,}which tradition tells us was once a{plague } {cottage.} One local resident thought he had 'seen' her, in fact it was his first encounter with a bee-keeper!
